Package org.example

Class NewExperiment

java.lang.Object
HAL.GridsAndAgents.AgentGrid2D<Cells>
org.example.Experiment
All Implemented Interfaces:
HAL.Interfaces.Grid2D, Serializable, Iterable<Cells>
public class NewExperiment extends HAL.GridsAndAgents.AgentGrid2D<Cells>
The NewExperiment class represents a simulation experiment with individual cells in a 2D square grid. It extends the AgentGrid2D class with agents of type Cells, which represent the individual cells in the simulation. The simulation involves interactions between cells, drug diffusion, virus concentration dynamics, and immune response. The experiment can be run for a specified number of ticks, and the state of the system is visualized at each tick.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • NewExperiment

      public NewExperiment(int xDim, int yDim, int visScale, HAL.Rand rn, boolean isNirmatrelvir, boolean isRitonavirBoosted, int numberOfTicksDelay, double virusDiffCoeff, String inVivoOrInVitro, double fixedDamageRate)
      Initializes a new instance of the NewExperiment class with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      xDim - The x-dimension of the grid.
      yDim - The y-dimension of the grid.
      visScale - The visualization scale.
      rn - A random number generator.
      isNirmatrelvir - A boolean indicating whether Nirmatrelvir is used.
      isRitonavirBoosted - A boolean indicating whether Ritonavir boosting is used.
      numberOfTicksDelay - The number of ticks to delay drug administration.
      virusDiffCoeff - The virus diffusion coefficient.
      inVivoOrInVitro - The type of experiment (inVivo or inVitro).
      fixedDamageRate - The fixed damage rate.

  • Method Details

    • Init

      public void Init()
      Initializes the simulation by setting up the grid and initializing cells based on specified ratios. This method writes the header for output files and populates the grid with cells based on random values and predefined ratios for healthy, infected, and capillary cells.

    • RunExperiment

      public double RunExperiment(HAL.Gui.GridWindow win)
      Runs the simulation for a specified number of ticks, updating the model and visualizing it at each step. The method also monitors and reports specific events during the simulation, such as reaching a fixed damage rate.
      Parameters:
      win - The GUI window for visualization.
      Returns:
      The count of healthy cells at the end of the simulation.
